dialog: Hello Medi, I'm not feeling well. I have a persistent cough and difficulty breathing.
I'm here to help. Cough and difficulty breathing can be symptoms of a respiratory infection.
I'm worried it might be pneumonia. Can you give me some advice?
If you have severe symptoms, it's best to seek medical attention. A chest radiograph can help diagnose pneumonia.
Will the X-ray always show if it's bacterial or viral?
Unfortunately, X-ray findings don't always differentiate between bacterial and viral infections.
That's concerning. What are the different types of pneumonia?
Pneumonia can be classified as lobar pneumonia, bronchopneumonia, lobular pneumonia, and interstitial pneumonia.
How do these different types present in X-rays?
knowledge: Pneumonia Pneumonia If a person is sufficiently sick to require hospitalization, a chest radiograph is recommended. Findings do not always match the severity of disease and do not reliably separate between bacterial and viral infection. X-ray presentations of pneumonia may be classified as lobar pneumonia, bronchopneumonia, lobular pneumonia, and interstitial pneumonia. Bacterial, community-acquired pneumonia classically show lung consolidation of one lung segmental lobe, which is known as lobar pneumonia. However, findings may vary, and other patterns are common in other types of pneumonia. Aspiration pneumonia may present with bilateral opacities primarily in the bases of the lungs and on the right side. Radiographs of viral pneumonia may appear normal, appear hyper-inflated, have bilateral patchy areas, or present similar to bacterial pneumonia with lobar consolidation Pneumonia Pneumonia
response: The X-ray presentations vary depending on the type of pneumonia. Bacterial pneumonia usually shows lung consolidation of one lung segmental lobe, while viral pneumonia may have normal or hyper-inflated appearance, bilateral patchy areas, or lobar consolidation.
